title: 'It's an honour' - Harden into NBA top 10 scorers
description: James Harden passes Carmelo Anthony on the NBA's all-time scoring list as the Minnesota Timberwolves defeat the LA Clippers.

title: Kings' Russell Westbrook passes Allen Iverson on historic NBA record list
description: Russ just keeps chugging along and doing his thing.

title: Struggling Clippers release NBA great Paul
description: The Los Angeles Clippers release 12-time NBA All-Star Chris Paul following the side's dreadful start to the season.

title: Nuggets' Jamal Murray makes basketball history never done in NBA
description: The Denver Nuggets' star point guard is in the record books after his most recent standout performance.

title: Proposed four-team blockbuster Lakers trade lands $212 million Knicks star, NBA champion
description: A massive multi-team trade concept would strengthen the Los Angeles Lakers' roster.

title: Pacers beat Wizards in matchup of NBA's two worst teams
description: The Pacers improved to 3-16 behind the sublime play of Pascal Siakam in 119-86 win over woeful Wizards

title: NBA Cup 2025: Magic beat Pistons in winner-take-all game behind Desmond Bane's 37 points
description: The Desmond Bane trade bore some fruit for the Orlando Magic in the NBA Cup on Friday.

title: Donovan Mitchell’s heroics weren’t enough, Cavs lose to Hawks 130-123
description: The loss keeps the Cavaliers from advancing out of the group stage in the NBA Cup for the third-straight season.

title: Jalen Johnson's triple-double leads Hawks to 130-123 victory over Cavaliers in NBA Cup game
description: Jalen Johnson had 29 points, 12 rebounds and 12 assists to lead the Atlanta Hawks to a 130-123 win over the Cleveland Cavaliers in an NBA Cup game on Friday night.  Atlanta eliminated Cleveland from the in-season tournament, meaning neither team advances to the quarterfinal round.  Nickeil Alexander-Walker added 28 points, including a clutch late 3-pointer, helping Atlanta go on an 7-0 run in less than 30 seconds to create separation.

title: Detroit Pistons whiff after 4th-quarter rally in NBA Cup loss to Magic
description: Detroit Pistons score: A 10-point fourth-quarter rally was for naught as the Pistons lost to the Orlando Magic in NBA Cup play at LCA on Friday.

title: NBA Jam's Iconic Announcer Barely Made Any Money From It
description:
If you grew up during the '90s and played NBA Jam, then you know the voice of Tim Kitzrow. His memorable commentary on the game became part of NBA Jam's blockbuster success in arcades. However, Kitzrow has revealed that he was paid a very small amount for his work in the first game.
While speaking with The Escapist, Kitzrow disclosed that he was paid $50 an hour for his work on NBA Jam, which was the same amount of money he made recording lines for Bally Midway's pinball machines. It wasn't until after the game was released that Kitzrow realized that he should have charged more.

title: Beloved Warriors center Kevon Looney sends clear reminder of insane NBA talent
description: This is quite the thing to watch.

title: Mitchell scores 32, Garland adds 20 in return as Cavaliers beat Pacers 120-109 in NBA Cup
description: Donovan Mitchell scored 32 points, Darius Garland had 20 in his return to Cleveland's lineup and the Cavaliers pulled away in the second half for a 120-109 victory over the Indiana Pacers in an NBA Cup game on Friday night.  It was the first meeting between the teams since the Pacers eliminated the top-seeded Cavaliers in five games in last season’s Eastern Conference semifinals.  Evan Mobley added 22 points and 12 rebounds for the Cavaliers, who improved to 2-1 in East Group A.

title: Andrew Nembhard scores 32 for Pacers in NBA Cup loss to Cavaliers
description: The Pacers' starters are returning and playing better but there's still not enough of them. Cavs win 120-109 in NBA Cup game

title: Report: Los Angeles Lakers sign former Gonzaga standout Drew Timme to two-way contract
description: Nov. 21—Drew Timme's hot start to the G League season hasn't gone unnoticed by members of the Los Angeles Lakers front office. The former Gonzaga standout will reportedly get another shot in the NBA after being waived by the Brooklyn Nets last month. As of Friday afternoon, Timme was in the process of signing a two-way contract with the Los Angeles Lakers, who are expected to waive either ...

title: NBA scout pours cold water on LeBron James and Luka Doncic's scorching hot Lakers
description: ESPN didn’t hold back on pointing out areas where the Lakers have struggled.
